intro: Spermolepis patens var. inermis, commonly known as the smoothleaf beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged opposite along the stem. This perennial plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its unique floral structure supports pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
